titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Ron Meisel Photographs of Coney Island
2005-2008
PR 377
titlestmt.author: Marybeth Kavanagh

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:47:40 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ron Meisel photographs of Coney Island
did.abstract: This collection consists of 10 color photographs of Coney Island, taken by photographer Ron Meisel (1952-) between 2005 and 2007. Images include amusement park attractions and participants in the annual Mermaid Parade. Also included is a small exhibition catalog, "Greetings from Coney Island" from a 2008 exhibition of Meisel's photographs at the Brooklyn Public Library.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers by appointment only.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to reproduce any Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections holdings through publication must be obtained from: Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 288. rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as: Ron Meisel Photographs of Coney Island, PR 377, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Credit line should read: Â© [date], Ron Meisel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 10 color photographs of Coney Island, taken by photographer Ron Meisel (1952-) between 2005 and 2007. Images include amusement park attractions and participants in the annual Mermaid Parade on the boardwalk. Also included is a small exhibition catalog, "Greetings from Coney Island" from a 2008 exhibition of Meisel's work at the Brooklyn Public Library.

Eight of the photographs are panoramic photos taken on color negative film and scanned on an Epson scanner. All of the photos were printed on archival paper using an Epson 4800 printer with Epson Ultrachrome K3 inks. The 8 panoramic photos measure 17"x42" and the remaining 2 photos measure 17"x22".

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Photographer Ron Meisel was born in New York City in 1952. He worked as a computer programmer and consultant form 1972-2001. Meisel joined the Soho Photo Gallery, a cooperative photography gallery, in 2003, and began photographing Coney Island in 2004.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Five photographs were purchased and five photographs were the gift of the artist, Ron Meisel.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: These photographs were previously part of the N-YHS Collection of Geographic Images PR 20 [formerly Geographic File]. They were removed and processed by Archivist Marybeth Kavanagh, January 2019.

controlaccess.geogname: Coney Island (New York, N.Y.) -- Pictorial works.
